ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I further developed my knowledge of the Spanish language. I also learned about Spanish and hispanic culture through various assignments and presentations during the semester.
I learned to speak Spanish much more confidently and greatly improved my writing
All-round Spanish skills, but especially writing in Spanish because we did so much of it.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It is a very time intensive course. It's difficult for some individuals who have had no prior knowledge of this foreign language, but it works well to keep the focus on moving forward and constantly improving.
We spoke a lot in Spanish
I felt we could have read more Spanish and done more interesting readings
We were given a lot of practice problems both in class and outside of class, which helped a lot during exams. However, we didn't do as much conversation, so I was very nervous for the oral exam.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to any student that wants to improve their Spanish abilities. There are a lot of writing opportunities and interesting stories to read.
Yes, I enjoyed it and am now a much better Spanish student!
Yes; I did become a better Spanish student as a whole by the end of the course. Our professor was also very patient and understanding of all the errors that were made.
